DOC.brief_summary: The Study Novel Approaches Prevention ( SNAP ) randomize trial design test whether behavioral intervention base self-regulation prevent weight gain young adult ( 18-35 year ; body mass index ( BMI ) 21-30 kg/m2 ) . Two different self-regulation intervention weight gain prevention compare trial ; one intervention focus make small , consistent , change eat exercise behavior prevent weight gain reverse weight gain occurs , whereas emphasize large change eat exercise occur periodically , goal produce weight loss thereby provide buffer anticipate weight gain . The primary aim trial test whether magnitude weight gain baseline across average three-year follow-up differs across three group , hypothesis weight gain great Control group either intervention great Small Changes Large Changes group . SNAP-E ( Extension ) determine whether effect intervention maintain additional 3 year ( i.e . total 6 year ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . BMI 21 30 kg/m2 1 . Untreated hypertension , hyperlipidemia , type 2 diabetes , unless permission provide health care provider . 2 . Heart disease , heart problem report prescribe drug blood pressure major heart condition , unless permission provide health care provider . 3 . Type 1 diabetes treatment type 2 diabetes insulin oral medication may cause hypoglycemia . 4 . Health problem may influence ability walk physical activity ( e.g . low limb amputation ) reason person physical activity , unless permission provide health care provider . 5 . Health problem may associate unintentional weight change affect safety weight loss program , include report heart attack stroke , chest pain period activity rest , loss consciousness , active tuberculosis , HIV , chronic hepatitis B C , inflammatory bowel disease require treatment within past year , thyroid disease , renal disease , liver disease , hospitalization asthma past year , cancer within past 5 year ( except nonmelanoma skin cancer early stage cervical cancer ) chronic use steroid medication . 6 . Report past diagnosis treatment Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental DisordersFourth EditionText Revision ( DSMIVTR ) eat disorder ( anorexia nervosa bulimia nervosa ) meet criterion anorexia bulimia nervosa screen trial 7 . Report past diagnosis current symptom alcohol substance dependence . 8 . Currently pregnant , pregnant within past 6 month , plan become pregnant within next 6 month . 9 . History schizophrenia , manic depression , bipolar disorder . 10 . Hospitalization depression psychiatric disorder within past 12 month . 11 . Having lose maintained weight loss 10 pound within past 6 month currently participate weight loss program , try gain weight , use steroid muscle mass weight gain , take weight loss medication , surgery weight loss . 12 . Participation another weight loss physical activity study would interfere study . 13 . Another member household ( roommate ) participant staff member trial . 14 . Reason suspect participant would adhere study intervention assessment schedule ( i.e. , ca n't come group regular basis ; away two week initial intervention phase plan move area within next year ) . 15 . Not able speak understand English . 16 . Residence place work 30 mile intervention site . 17 . Perceived inability attend 2 year data collection visit . 18 . Does Internet access regular basis .
